item.description:
This will be a loop hike using some of the Northwood Meadow State Park Trails as well some that goes to the northern peak of Saddleback Mountain.  There is a ledge area there where there are some views of Mountains.  The loop forms a weirdly shaped figure 8 of sorts.  This hike could probably be rated as easy/moderate depending on your hiking ability.  The hike does have some elevation gain likely in the 300 - 400 foot neighborhood.  I don't know exactly as I haven't  been able to find anything online to tell me so far, I just know while doing the uphill parts it never felt like I was really having to exert myself that much to get up a hilly part.

Parts of the trails are wide, some parts are dirt roads, other parts are narrower footpaths were you need to watch were you are putting your feet.  I will at some point post some photos as a preview of the hike.

Links to Trail Maps:

http://www.nhstateparks.org/uploads/pdf/NALMC-TrailMap091208.pdf

http://www.nalmc.net/uploads/Projects_EA_Map6_Trails.pdf

There are some pictures 3-29 in the photo album that are previews of what one can see on the hike:

http://www.meetup.com/Manchester-Doggie-Paws/photos/8324582/
item.how_to_find_us: So the dogs will be out of traffic away from the parking lot, we will meet just past the gated trail head.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Northwood Meadows State Park - Saddleback Mtn. 6 mile Loop Hike.
